template.name: Advanced Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2
template.description:
Link: https://github.com/XaTTa6bl4/zabbix-mikrotik Redesigned by Taurus (https://github.com/RusTaurus)
Based on Zabbix 3.4.5 official Template Net Mikrotik version: 0.15 (https://share.zabbix.com/official-templates) MIBs used: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB MIKROTIK-MIB Known Issues: description : Doesn't have ifHighSpeed filled. fixed in more recent versions version : RotuerOS 6.28 or lower device : description : Doesn't have any temperature sensors version : RotuerOS 6.38.5 device : Mikrotik 941-2nD, Mikrotik 951G-2HnD

item.name: Lease count
item.description: MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB mtxrDHCPLeaseCount - Current DHCP server lease count

item.name: Level
item.description: MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB mtxrLicLevel - Current key level

item.name: Upgradeable to
item.description: MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB mtxrLicUpgradableTo - Key file upgradable up to this level

item.name: Version build time
item.description: MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB mtxrBuildTime - RouterOS build time

item.name: Device: CPU Frequency
item.description: MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB (mtxrHlProcessorFrequency) CPU frequency in Mhz. Reference: http://wiki.mikrotik.com/wiki/Manual:SNMP

item.name: Device: Active Fan
item.description: MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB (mtxrHlActiveFan) Device active fan presence. Reference: http://wiki.mikrotik.com/wiki/Manual:SNMP

item.name: Total memory
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The size of the storage represented by this entry, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits. This object is writable to allow remote configuration of the size of the storage area in those cases where such an operation makes sense and is possible on the underlying system. For example, the amount of main memory allocated to a buffer pool might be modified or the amount of disk space allocated to virtual memory might be modified.

item.name: Used memory
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits.

item_prototype.name: #{#SNMPINDEX}: CPU utilization
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The average, over the last minute, of the percentage of time that this processor was not idle.Implementations may approximate this one minute smoothing period if necessary.

discovery_rule.name: IP Addresses Discovery
discovery_rule.description:
Discovering IP from all interfaces. Only _PUBLIC_ IP discovered!! Pls add "IP addresses for discovery" global regular expression for correct work.
1 ^(172\.(1+[6-9]|2+[0-9]|3+[0-2])\.)+[0-9]{1,3}+\.+[0-9]{1,3}$ [Result is FALSE] 2 ^(10\.[0-9]{1,3}\.)+[0-9]{1,3}+\.+[0-9]{1,3}$ [Result is FALSE] 3 ^(192\.168\.)+[0-9]{1,3}+\.+[0-9]{1,3}$ [Result is FALSE]

trigger_prototype.expression: {Advanced Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:icmppingloss[{#IPADDR}].min(5m)}>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and {Advanced Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:icmppingloss[{#IPADDR}].min(5m)}<100
trigger_prototype.name: High ICMP ping loss

dependency.name: High ICMP ping loss
dependency.expression: {Advanced Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:icmppingloss[{#IPADDR}].min(5m)}>{$ICMP_LOSS_WARN} and {Advanced Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:icmppingloss[{#IPADDR}].min(5m)}<100

trigger_prototype.name: Unavailable by ICMP ping
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Last three attempts returned timeout. Please check device connectivity.

discovery_rule.name: CPU Temperature Discovery
discovery_rule.description: MIKROTIK-MIB::mtxrHlProcessorTemperature Since temperature of CPU is not available on all Mikrotik hardware, this is done to avoid unsupported items.

item_prototype.name: CPU: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB (mtxrHlProcessorTemperature) Processor temperature in Celsius (degrees C). Might be missing in entry models (RB750, RB450G..)

trigger_prototype.name: CPU: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"CPU"}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

trigger_prototype.name: CPU: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP_WARN:"CPU"}
trigger_prototype.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. This trigger uses temperature sensor values as well as temperature sensor status if available

dependency.name: CPU: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"CPU"}

discovery_rule.name: Device Temperature Discovery
discovery_rule.description: MIKROTIK-MIB::mtxrHlTemperature Device temperature in Celsius (degrees C). Since temperature of Mikrotik device is not available on all Mikrotik hardware, this is done to avoid unsupported items. Reference: http://wiki.mikrotik.com/wiki/Manual:SNMP

item_prototype.name: Device: Temperature
item_prototype.description: MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB (mtxrHlTemperature) Mikrotik device temperature in Celsius (degrees C). Might be missing in entry models (RB750, RB450G..)

trigger_prototype.name: Device: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"Device"}
Device: Temperature is above warning threshold: >{$TEMP_WARN:"Device"}

dependency.name: Device: Temperature is above critical threshold: >{$TEMP_CRIT:"Device"}

discovery_rule.name: Voltage Discovery
discovery_rule.description: MIKROTIK-MIB::mtxrHlVoltage Since Voltage measuring is not available on all Mikrotik hardware, this is done to avoid unsupported items.

item_prototype.name: Board: Voltage
item_prototype.description: MIB: MIKROTIK-MIB (mtxrHlVoltage) Board voltage in Volts. Might be missing in entry models (RB750, RB450G..)

discovery_rule.name: Neighbor Discovery
discovery_rule.description: MIKROTIK-MIB mtxrNeighborTable - CDP/LLDP neighbors discovery rule

item_prototype.name: {#IPADDR} - Linked interface
item_prototype.description: Translate output of MIKROTIK-MIB::mtxrNeighborInterfaceID to interface name from IF-MIB::ifDescr

item_prototype.name: {#IPADDR} - Platform
item_prototype.description: MIKROTIK-MIB::mtxrNeighborPlatform - Name of the neighbor's platform

item_prototype.name: {#IPADDR} - Remote RouterOS version
item_prototype.description: MIKROTIK-MIB::mtxrNeighborSoftwareID - RouterOS software ID on a remote device. Applies only to devices installed with RouterOS.

item_prototype.name: {#IPADDR} - Installed software
item_prototype.description: MIKROTIK-MIB::mtxrNeighborVersion - Version number of installed software on a remote device

item_prototype.name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Total space
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The size of the storage represented by this entry, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits. This object is writable to allow remote configuration of the size of the storage area in those cases where such an operation makes sense and is possible on the underlying system. For example, the amount of main memory allocated to a buffer pool might be modified or the amount of disk space allocated to virtual memory might be modified.

item_prototype.name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Used space
item_prototype.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits.

trigger_prototype.name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is critically low

dependency.name: Disk-{#SNMPINDEX}: Disk space is critically low

trigger.expression: {Advanced Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber.diff()}=1 and {Advanced Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:system.hw.serialnumber.strlen()}>0
trigger.name: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Device serial number has changed. Ack to close

trigger.expression: {Advanced Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:system.hw.firmware.diff()}=1 and {Advanced Template Net Mikrotik SNMPv2:system.hw.firmware.strlen()}>0
trigger.name: Firmware has changed
trigger.description: Last value: {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}. Firmware version has changed. Ack to close
